data.text:
ğŸ‰Thrilled to Share Our Journey at Weihack 5.0!ğŸš€ Iâ€™m excited to announce that alongside my brilliant team member, Anshika Arora, we participated in the renowned hackathon, Weihack 5.0, a 36-hours long women centric hackathon conducted by BVPIEEE, which witnessed participation from over 1800 teams nationwide. It was a rollercoaster of coding, collaboration, and creativity, and Iâ€™m proud to say that our team, Encoders, made it to the top 50!ğŸ† It was my first hackathon, and the experience was exhilarating. The event was a melting pot of ideas, where we not only honed our technical skills but also learned the importance of teamwork and perseverance. Our project aimed to create a safer world for women, travelers, and students by developing a website that predicts high-risk areas and suggests the safest travel times, while also providing historical crime data to inform users of potential dangers. The challenge was immense, but so was our passion for making a difference. Though we didnâ€™t clinch the top spot, the hackathon was a win for us in so many other ways. We got to learn about the power of data analytics in real-world applications and the impact of technology on social issues. We experienced the excitement of turning a concept into a tangible product. We are not stopping here, the journey continues. We are dedicated to enhancing our project, refining its features, and improving its effectiveness. Stay tuned as weâ€™ll be sharing the final version of our project soon. #Weihack5 #Hackathon #WomenSafety #DataAnalytics #Teamwork #Innovation

ğŸ“£ Weâ€™ve recently started interviewing past winners, runner-ups, and participants about their #GovHack #hackathon experiences. Over the coming weeks, weâ€™ll be sharing these inspiring stories, so stay tuned! ğŸ¶ To kick things off, we had the privilege of speaking with Esther Anderson, the winner of #GovHack 2018. Estherâ€™s story is quite unique: She initially mentored at a Regional hackathon in Mandurah, WA, but ended up participating herself. Now, we can reasonably easily scale hackathons out into the country. However due to lower overall population numbers, it can be challenging to ensure higher show up rates. Undeterred, Esther decided to seize the opportunity and contribute to the hackathon. Her team developed an innovative app called SeeCHANGE, designed to make regional towns more appealing to potential residents. SeeCHANGE functions like a wizard: users input their requirementsâ€”such as job availability, local amenities, and proximity to schoolsâ€”and receive a recommendation with a percentage score indicating how well different towns match their criteria. For example, it considers proximity to suitable local hospitals for those with health conditions. Team Hack aPeel created this app because they hadn't seen a comprehensive solution for relocating to country areas. To make it work, SeeCHANGE utilised a wide range of government #opendata sets. Team Hack aPeel came up with this idea, because they hadn't seen an app that acted like a one-stop-shop for sea changes. To achieve this SeeCHANGE pulled in a whole host of government #opendata sets. End of story? Not quite! Team Hack aPeel scored big: they won both the Regional WA and National awards in their category. This is a testament to how flexibility, creativity, and determination can lead a small regional team to national success! If you would like to watch Esther's interview, please find it in the comment section. #GovHackAU #GovHack2024 #winner

#HackFest5.0 #DTDL #TeamWork ğŸš€ HACKFEST: Where the ideas get Wired! ğŸš€ Get ready to push the boundaries of creativity and innovation! ğŸ”¥ The much-awaited HACKFEST 5.0 is here, and it's a journey into the future of tech and beyond. ğŸŒŒ ğŸ”¥ Feel the adrenaline rush as you race against the clock, Tick Tock. Driven by passion and a commitment to making a difference, HackFest offers you an innovation playground filled with mentors, workshops, and endless resources.ğŸ’ª ğŸ† It's not just about winning; it's about the experience. It all started with an idea and now we are here in the middle of our journey with friendships forged along the way. Whether you're hacking solo or teaming up with others, HackFest is where ideas come to life and dreams become reality. ğŸš€ Hina Chhikara Winny Singh Nihar Mathur #DTDL #HACKTHON 5.0 #DTDLHACKFEST #TEAMGENESIS MAYANK KUMAR MITTAL Sourabh Chaturvedi

What can non-technical professionals do at the zero-knowledge hackathon? A lot of cool stuff! I described my ZK Hack experience in the new article on HackerNoon ğŸ˜ I recommend reading it to those who are interested in how ZK hackathons are held and more about the possibilities of ZKPs. In the article, I mentioned zkSync, o1Labs, HylÃ©, and others. The article made it to the TOP5 on the main page, so the it's definitely worth your attention ğŸ™ŒğŸ» I will be happy to answer your questions. Read the text by the link in the first comment â¤µï¸ #dariastrategy #zeroknowledge #web3community #contentmarketing

ğŸš€ Thrilled to share my exhilarating experience at the virtual edition of HackStreet 2.0, hosted under the banner of XENITH'24! ğŸŒŸ ğŸ’» Despite being miles apart, the virtual space buzzed with the same energy and enthusiasm as an in-person hackathon. From virtual brainstorming sessions to late-night coding marathons, every moment was an adventure in innovation. ğŸ” Exploring the latest tech trends and collaborating with fellow hackers from around the globe was an enriching experience. Together, we tackled challenges head-on, leveraging our diverse skills and perspectives to craft ingenious solutions. ğŸ† Grateful for the recognition our team received among the top contenders! It's a testament to our dedication, teamwork, and passion for pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the digital realm. ğŸŒ This virtual hackathon journey has not only honed my technical skills but also reinforced the importance of adaptability and resilience in today's dynamic world. Excited to carry the momentum forward and continue making waves in the tech community! #VirtualHackathon #HackStreet2 #XENITH24 #TechInnovation #GlobalCollaboration #DigitalTransformation

Reflecting on our remarkable journey at the Hackhazards24 hackathon by nameSpace Community held in Delhi: this experience proved to be a transformative learning curve for us. Out of 500+ teams, we were selected and advanced to the offline rounds, a testament to our team's dedication and innovative approach. While we may not have clinched a prize this time, our unwavering commitment, resilience, and collaborative spirit set us apart. Every challenge was met with determination, showcasing our potential for greatness. Although victory eluded us this round, we're fueled with newfound motivation for the next challenge. Proud of my team's efforts ARYAN SHARMA, Akshat Verma. Winning extends beyond the leaderboard: it encompasses the invaluable lessons learned, the unforgettable experiences gained, and the connections forged. I am grateful for the opportunity and look forward to participating in future hackathons. Stay tuned as I'll be sharing the project we worked upon, and watch this space for our continued journey towards success! #HackathonHeroes #Resilience #Innovation #Teamwork #NextChapter"
